and take it to its natural conclusion
conclusion their arguments a single
day's absence from school I might
reserve criminal offence
and no court was ever going to agree
that that was what regularly meant for
the terms of it in terms of the
Education Act mr. Baker you must be very
disappointed is going to be quite
difficult to stop parents now
taking their children out of school for
holidays during term time I think you're
quite right but what we wanted today was
clarity and you guidance clear guidance
on what the law meant I'm afraid we've
got the absolute opposite to that really
we've got a situation when yes without
recourse it looks as if parents can now
take their children out of school for
maybe up to three weeks a year we've got
a clear clearly shown in court was a
link between educational attainment and
attendance so my worry is that those
children who are taken out of school
will suffer in their education but it
will also have a knock-on effect on the

and also the work of teachers in the
classroom but I understand that the
government have already indicated
they're going to look at this I would
certainly urge the Department of
Education to do so urgently
one thing happened in there was that the
court effectively rejected the
Department of Education is view on what
constitutes regular attendance I think
that's got to be a concern we've got to
get this tidied up and that's all we've
been trying to do throughout this
process that what's your reaction to
that sorry Jonathan but that's not I was
in the same court as you and when you
say the Department for Education
definition of regular attendance what do
you mean is the person who responded to

very junior person in the department for
education
you know if the department for education
honestly believed the regular attendance
at school meant every single day they
would amend the legislation overnight
section 444 wouldn't read a parent
commits an offense of a child attending
school regularly it would say a parent
commits an offense if the child misses
any day at school without lawful reason
they could change it overnight but
that's not their position MPs are not
going to line up in the lobbies to
criminalize hundreds of thousands of
parents for taking their kids on holiday
it's never going to happen you know
that's why we have primary and secondary
legislation primary legislation goes
before Parliament and MPs have to put
their democratic mandate on the line and
if parents don't accept that they will
um be removed from office and what they
want to do is do it by the backdoor what
they want to do is say well we'll set
the threshold as regularly but we'll in
the Department for Education a construe
that as every single day and the judge
said it can't possibly be every single
day because if it was every single day
the legislation would say every single
day it seems you're a bit of a mess I
think the Department of Education and
schooling in this country is in a bit of
a mess because we simply don't know what
the situation is can you take your child
out of school when can you take your
child out of school should you be able
to take your own child out of school
with only out any control as I say it's
clearly shown that there's a link
between attainment and attendance at
school and that link has not apparently
been accepted by the court and I fear
massive disruption to schooling across
the country but the thing that restrict
the thing that stops parents taking
their kids are still Jonathan isn't the
fear of your 60-pound truancy penalty
notice it's the fear of the damage
you'll do to the kids education that's
the the restraining factor and parents
they're smart they can work this out
themselves they know if I pull my kids
out of school every time we go on
holiday in term time and there
attendance falls to 70 60% my child is
going to suffer so they don't do that
but when circumstances demand and they
want to take the child out of school
they should be able to and that's what
the High Court has said an unauthorized
holiday of itself cannot amount to a
breach of the legislation it might but
it might be three or four weeks of an
academic year just lastly are you going
to be taking your children out of school
next year during term time I'm getting
married in Santorini in 18 days my kids
are coming they will not miss a day of
school the last time my kids went in
holding was to Barcelona a few weeks ago
and it was in half term and they didn't
miss a day of school I try as much as
possible to take my kids on holiday when
it's the school holidays like everybody
else but sometimes you can't do that for
whatever reason and this mass finding is
there really gelatin in all seriousness
a hundred thousand parents in this
country who are so criminally
incompetent as parents that it warrants

is that your assessment of parents in

adhere is that there is uncertainty and

let's take it to government and see if

position whether the position the
council took in court or something in

actually all know where we stand that's
the absolute key to this in my view
